summary:
Jon: Stop it. Both of you. 
Arya & Gendry: Stop what?
Jon: That ... that starin' thing you're doing.
Arya, shrugs: I could kiss...
body:
Jon: Stop it. Both of you.

Arya & Gendry: Stop what?

Jon: That … that starin’ thing you’re doing.

Arya, shrugs: I could kiss him instead.

Jon: NO. NONE OF THAT.

Jon: NO. NONE OF THAT.

title: Second Conquest of Westeros
description:
by DumbDragon

Jon and Arya are twins, both grow up as bastard of Ned Stark. After running away from Winterfell both travel south and then to Essos to rescue Daenerys from the khal. After which three Targaryens try to take back they families throne.

Words: 1201, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: game of thrones
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Underage
  • Categories: F/M, Multi
  • Characters: Jon Snow | Jaehaerys Targaryen, Arya Stark | Alysanna Targaryen, Daenerys Targaryen, Lord Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Robb Stark, Sansa Stark, Varys (ASoIaF), Aegon Targaryen, Tywin Lannister
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Jon Snow/Arya Stark/Daenerys Targaryen

Summary:

It was only a kiss. One stupid little kiss. A New Year’s kiss with Arya Stark. It shouldn’t have meant anything. Not now, not after all these years.

Initially inspired by the song Mr. Brightside by The Killers and only slightly inspired further by the gendrya fanfic ‘A Part of You’ by elenei

blog.description: Nerdy fandom tumblr of Ashley Thomas--The Nerdy Blogger. Here I'll be letting my geek flag fly. Be prepared for science fiction and fantasy posts, literature, geek culture, and a lot of Star Trek. I am complete Jaime/Brienne shipper trash. I want to be Hermione Granger, Leslie Knope, and Brienne of Tarth when I grow up. Follow me at nerdyblogging.wordpress.com.

summary: Who Is The Younger, More Beautiful (Queen) On Game of Thrones? | Fangirlish
title: Who Is The Younger, More Beautiful (Queen) On Game of Thrones? | Fangirlish
excerpt: Who holds the title of younger more beautiful queen? Daenerys, Sansa, Brienne, or even Arya? Who will cast Cersei down and take all she holds dear?
description: My first original piece on Fangirlish speculates on who might be the younger, more beautiful (queen) on Game of Thrones. I take a look at who meets the qualifications of the prophecy and rank them in terms of likelihood.

tags: their reunion is as it should be tbh
summary:
I hope they eat the Hound. She remembered what he'd said, about wolves and dogs.

  

"You want me dead that bad? Then do it,...
body:
I hope they eat the Hound. She remembered what he’d said, about wolves and dogs.

“You want me dead that bad? Then do it, wolf girl.”

these two have some of the best animal symbolism in the series between them. and it actually plays a big role in their dynamic. most people refer to sandor as “the hound” for obvious reasons. his sigil, his helm, and his loyalty to his masters. sandor has his own relationship to the name but ultimately its used by others disparagingly. arya wants to kill “the hound” because he murdered her friend mycah on the lannisters orders. but as they spend more time together the line between the hound and sandor becomes blurred 

and sandor is the same with arya. he almost always refers to arya with wolf names. (theres a very select few exceptions but regardless never by her actual name) wolf girl, she wolf, wolf b*tch ect. this is as dehumanizing as what the rest of westeros does to sandor. he sees arya as this fierce and monstrous little creature - and treats her as such - rather than a scared little girl. but at the same time i do think he has a certain amount of respect for her wolf like qualities too.

tags: I really hope she gets some romantic scenes in the show and the books just to prove people wrong
yes I'm being petty and salty
summary: A few years ago I really didn’t really ship Arya with anyone but then the “Arya’s too far gone” and “she’s killed too many...
body: A few years ago I really didn’t really ship Arya with anyone but then the “Arya’s too far gone” and “she’s killed too many people to ever be in a relationship” shitposts started and now I want Arya to get some loving (I don’t even care who it is) just so I can be petty and rub it in people’s faces.

summary: To go South - chapter 49 - Narrow escape
title: To go South - chapter 49 - Narrow escape
body:
So, here an Arya PoV on the Battle of Winterfell, with a bit of Gendrya smuggled into it. Also on AO3.

Another swing, just another swing. To stop swinging means death. Arya cursed. How had they managed to get cut off when Bran had closed the crypst, she did not really know. She just knew that bloody Tyrion Lannister had made Jaime and Brienne stop fighting, and her and Gendry had been pushed somehow by the Unsullied that had fought with them. They had fought with wights and somehow, they had been separated from the others. Pushed or lured. How could I have been that stupid? Now, no Unsullied were in sight, although Arya frantically looked for them.

But cursing herself would not help. Gendry swung his big hammer, but everytime they came across a White Walker, it was Arya and her dagger that had to do the work.

“We have to find a way out,” Arya called. “We don’t have much time.”

The trap would be sprung any time now, and Arya was thinking fervently about a way to leave the castle.

They ran into a room with a window and Arya shouted at Gendry that he should barricade the door. She could hear steps behind her. She fervently took off the curtains from the window. She just put a corner of the cloth around the table that stood in the room and shoved it to the window, opening the shutters. She climbed on the table.

“I’ll go first, I’m lighter.” She lowered herself through the window, praying that the curtain would hold. The curtain ended about her height above ground, and she jumped. Fortunately, the snow was soft. She ran until she had reached what she judged to be a safe distance and looked back. Gendry was climbing down, but to her horror she saw another figure in frame of the window. She could not see if it was a living person or one of the Undead. The man swung over and began climbing down as well. The curtain did not hold and both men fell.

Arya ran back, screaming. It was not a Wight, but one of the Unsullied. He had regained his feet and raised his spear. Gendry was not moving. Arya did not think, what to do. She just threw herself against the massive man, and the momentum of her jump made him stumble at least.

“Gendry”, she shouted, but he did not answer. Arya had stopped the man for the moment, but he was far bigger than her, and he moved forward with his spear.

Arya could have cried. She was so tired already and her fast descent down the curtain had burned her left hand. She switched the dagger to her right, dancing around the man. She willed Gendry to open his eyes, but he did not move.

“Why do you do this? We have to get away, the trap will be sprung any moment now!”, she shouted at the man. His answer was unintelligible to her, but his intent was clear.

I don’t want to die in a wildfire explosion.

Arya thought she saw the three fires on the towers that were the signal. In a desperate attempt to finish the fight she prepared to jump the man and to go for his windpipe. But her foot tangled up in the cursed curtain, and she fell into the snow.

Death by spear it is then. She could have cried.

She heard a screech. The dragons? She did not want to get up. She did not want to see her own death, but some instinct made her straighten up and look what awaited her. She just saw her big opponent being pierced by another spear, this time a White Walker. He must have come after them. It would only take a second until the man was turned. Arya fumbled and threw her dagger, praying to all the gods.

Her valyrian dagger just grazed the Walker but it was enough. He shattered.

Arya heard screeches again. Later she could not have said, how she did it, but her last reserves were enough to roll Gendry on the rests of the curtain and to half roll him half push him away from the castle.

When the wildfire exploded behind her, she threw herself over Gendry with her last strength. The fear and the tension finally overcame her, and blessed darkness surrounded her.

When she opened her eyes again, Gendry had wrapped her in the rests of the curtain and held her to warm her.

“What happened?”, she asked.

“I would like to know as well.”, he answered. He looked battered. His left eye was swollen shut and his hands were trembling. Arya took his hands to keep them from trembling and realised that she was trembling herself.

Arya told him about the man who had tried to kill him. Her head was spinning, and she wondered why.

“How long have I been unconscious?” she asked him. It was strange, that she felt safe, although all around them the castle was burning.

“I have no idea, I was unconscious myself.”

“We should try to find someone. I really would like to know, if the plan worked.”

Gendry gestured around them. “The part about blowing up the castle, certainly did.”

Arya stood up and would have lost her footing when dizziness hit her, if Gendry had not caught her. Arya felt the blood rush in her veins, but the strange spinning of her head did not stop.

She let Gendry help her walk. Although he had gotten hit on the head, he stood and walked steady. Arya was puzzled about her spinning head. She blamed the screeching dragons. One of them was very faint, and she wondered why.

“You saved my life,” Gendry said.

“I am sure, Daenerys gave the order to have you killed. She is going to pay for that, and if it is the last thing I do.” The dark anger in her heart was almost enough to overwhelm the feeling of the whirlwind in her head.

They made their way slowly away from the castle. Gendry held her arm almost tenderly and Arya wondered how she could feel fatigue, anger, exhaustion, dizziness and happiness at the same time.

Gendry is alive. We survived. We survived.

She smiled up at him, and was puzzled, when he suddenly stopped, dread on his face.

There was a clearing ahead of them, and Arya could clearly make out a figure in the snow, her red hair spread around her in a halo that caught the early light of the morning. The snow beside her was red.

It was as if all her thoughts fled her and she stood rooted. She placed her feet one before the other and then she broke into a run, shaking off Gendry’s hand.

“Sansa!” Daenerys must have sent someone after her as well. How could I have been so stupid.

Olyvar stood beside Sansa in a gesture of grief, and Ghost was lying on the ground in a strange angle.

“Sansa”, Arya cried again. Her sister’s face was pale.

She knelt beside her and gathered her sister in his arms, tears streaming down her cheeks.

She almost let her fall, when she heard Sansa whisper.

“It’s just a show Arya, I’m fine, but please continue to play along.”

Arya felt dizzy again, but she did as Sansa told her, until she heard Olyvar speak.

“She flew to the godswood, just like Lord Bran said.”

Arya looked up and directly into Gendry’s eyes. Olyvar had placed a hand on Gendry’s arm to hold him back.

Sansa stood up and Gendry gasped. Ghost miraculously jumped up as well, came over and circled them, his tongue lolling. Arya laughed and dried her tears.

“Ghost,” she said.

“Ghost is a talented actor.”, Sansa told her. “Ghost, be a good boy. Play dead.”

Ghost dropped and came to lie in the strange angle Arya had seen before.

Arya laughed again until Sansa boxed her in her side.

“Shht.”, she said. “You’ll blow our story if you laugh to loud. Bran insisted that Daenerys needs to think that she has won.”

“You really gave me the fright of my life.” Arya shook her head. “Why did Bran not tell me?”

“We came up with the scheme on a whim when Olyvar told me that Daenerys had tried to bribe him to kill me.”

Sansa smiled. “And you are supposed to be down in the crypts.”

“There was a lot of confusion.” Arya told her. She rushed in her sister’s arms.

“Oh gods, is it over now? Is it finally over?”

“I hope so.”

“I don’t think so,” Olyvar interrupted them. He pointed at the godswood. They saw Drogon, a huge flame, the weirwood catching fire fast, and then the dragon fell.

It felt like the word was going to end. The impact drove them all to their knees.
body_abstract:
So, here an Arya PoV on the Battle of Winterfell, with a bit of Gendrya smuggled into it. Also on AO3.

Another swing, just another swing. To stop swinging means death. Arya cursed. How had they managed to get cut off when Bran had closed the crypst, she did not really know. She just knew that bloody Tyrion Lannister had made Jaime and Brienne stop fighting, and her and Gendry had been pushed somehow by the Unsullied that had fought with them. They had fought with wights and somehow, they had been separated from the others. Pushed or lured. How could I have been that stupid? Now, no Unsullied were in sight, although Arya frantically looked for them.

reblog.comment:
So, here an Arya PoV on the Battle of Winterfell, with a bit of Gendrya smuggled into it. Also on AO3.

Another swing, just another swing. To stop swinging means death. Arya cursed. How had they managed to get cut off when Bran had closed the crypst, she did not really know. She just knew that bloody Tyrion Lannister had made Jaime and Brienne stop fighting, and her and Gendry had been pushed somehow by the Unsullied that had fought with them. They had fought with wights and somehow, they had been separated from the others. Pushed or lured. How could I have been that stupid? Now, no Unsullied were in sight, although Arya frantically looked for them.

[[MORE]]

But cursing herself would not help. Gendry swung his big hammer, but everytime they came across a White Walker, it was Arya and her dagger that had to do the work.

“We have to find a way out,” Arya called. “We don’t have much time.”

The trap would be sprung any time now, and Arya was thinking fervently about a way to leave the castle.

They ran into a room with a window and Arya shouted at Gendry that he should barricade the door. She could hear steps behind her. She fervently took off the curtains from the window. She just put a corner of the cloth around the table that stood in the room and shoved it to the window, opening the shutters. She climbed on the table.

“I’ll go first, I’m lighter.” She lowered herself through the window, praying that the curtain would hold. The curtain ended about her height above ground, and she jumped. Fortunately, the snow was soft. She ran until she had reached what she judged to be a safe distance and looked back. Gendry was climbing down, but to her horror she saw another figure in frame of the window. She could not see if it was a living person or one of the Undead. The man swung over and began climbing down as well. The curtain did not hold and both men fell.

Arya ran back, screaming. It was not a Wight, but one of the Unsullied. He had regained his feet and raised his spear. Gendry was not moving. Arya did not think, what to do. She just threw herself against the massive man, and the momentum of her jump made him stumble at least.

“Gendry”, she shouted, but he did not answer. Arya had stopped the man for the moment, but he was far bigger than her, and he moved forward with his spear.

Arya could have cried. She was so tired already and her fast descent down the curtain had burned her left hand. She switched the dagger to her right, dancing around the man. She willed Gendry to open his eyes, but he did not move.

“Why do you do this? We have to get away, the trap will be sprung any moment now!”, she shouted at the man. His answer was unintelligible to her, but his intent was clear.

I don’t want to die in a wildfire explosion.

Arya thought she saw the three fires on the towers that were the signal. In a desperate attempt to finish the fight she prepared to jump the man and to go for his windpipe. But her foot tangled up in the cursed curtain, and she fell into the snow.

Death by spear it is then. She could have cried.

She heard a screech. The dragons? She did not want to get up. She did not want to see her own death, but some instinct made her straighten up and look what awaited her. She just saw her big opponent being pierced by another spear, this time a White Walker. He must have come after them. It would only take a second until the man was turned. Arya fumbled and threw her dagger, praying to all the gods.

Her valyrian dagger just grazed the Walker but it was enough. He shattered.

Arya heard screeches again. Later she could not have said, how she did it, but her last reserves were enough to roll Gendry on the rests of the curtain and to half roll him half push him away from the castle.

When the wildfire exploded behind her, she threw herself over Gendry with her last strength. The fear and the tension finally overcame her, and blessed darkness surrounded her.

When she opened her eyes again, Gendry had wrapped her in the rests of the curtain and held her to warm her.

“What happened?”, she asked.

“I would like to know as well.”, he answered. He looked battered. His left eye was swollen shut and his hands were trembling. Arya took his hands to keep them from trembling and realised that she was trembling herself.

Arya told him about the man who had tried to kill him. Her head was spinning, and she wondered why.

“How long have I been unconscious?” she asked him. It was strange, that she felt safe, although all around them the castle was burning.

“I have no idea, I was unconscious myself.”

“We should try to find someone. I really would like to know, if the plan worked.”

Gendry gestured around them. “The part about blowing up the castle, certainly did.”

Arya stood up and would have lost her footing when dizziness hit her, if Gendry had not caught her. Arya felt the blood rush in her veins, but the strange spinning of her head did not stop.

She let Gendry help her walk. Although he had gotten hit on the head, he stood and walked steady. Arya was puzzled about her spinning head. She blamed the screeching dragons. One of them was very faint, and she wondered why.

“You saved my life,” Gendry said.

“I am sure, Daenerys gave the order to have you killed. She is going to pay for that, and if it is the last thing I do.” The dark anger in her heart was almost enough to overwhelm the feeling of the whirlwind in her head.

They made their way slowly away from the castle. Gendry held her arm almost tenderly and Arya wondered how she could feel fatigue, anger, exhaustion, dizziness and happiness at the same time.

Gendry is alive. We survived. We survived.

She smiled up at him, and was puzzled, when he suddenly stopped, dread on his face.

There was a clearing ahead of them, and Arya could clearly make out a figure in the snow, her red hair spread around her in a halo that caught the early light of the morning. The snow beside her was red.

It was as if all her thoughts fled her and she stood rooted. She placed her feet one before the other and then she broke into a run, shaking off Gendry’s hand.

“Sansa!” Daenerys must have sent someone after her as well. How could I have been so stupid.

Olyvar stood beside Sansa in a gesture of grief, and Ghost was lying on the ground in a strange angle.

“Sansa”, Arya cried again. Her sister’s face was pale.

She knelt beside her and gathered her sister in his arms, tears streaming down her cheeks.

She almost let her fall, when she heard Sansa whisper.

“It’s just a show Arya, I’m fine, but please continue to play along.”

Arya felt dizzy again, but she did as Sansa told her, until she heard Olyvar speak.

“She flew to the godswood, just like Lord Bran said.”

Arya looked up and directly into Gendry’s eyes. Olyvar had placed a hand on Gendry’s arm to hold him back.

Sansa stood up and Gendry gasped. Ghost miraculously jumped up as well, came over and circled them, his tongue lolling. Arya laughed and dried her tears.

“Ghost,” she said.

“Ghost is a talented actor.”, Sansa told her. “Ghost, be a good boy. Play dead.”

Ghost dropped and came to lie in the strange angle Arya had seen before.

Arya laughed again until Sansa boxed her in her side.

“Shht.”, she said. “You’ll blow our story if you laugh to loud. Bran insisted that Daenerys needs to think that she has won.”

“You really gave me the fright of my life.” Arya shook her head. “Why did Bran not tell me?”

“We came up with the scheme on a whim when Olyvar told me that Daenerys had tried to bribe him to kill me.”

Sansa smiled. “And you are supposed to be down in the crypts.”

“There was a lot of confusion.” Arya told her. She rushed in her sister’s arms.

“Oh gods, is it over now? Is it finally over?”

“I hope so.”

“I don’t think so,” Olyvar interrupted them. He pointed at the godswood. They saw Drogon, a huge flame, the weirwood catching fire fast, and then the dragon fell.

It felt like the word was going to end. The impact drove them all to their knees.

summary: And then there’s also Gendry’s reunion with Arya (Maisie Williams), who he last saw in season 3. “He’s reunited with Arya again....
body: And then there’s also Gendry’s reunion with Arya (Maisie Williams), who he last saw in season 3. “He’s reunited with Arya again. So a lot for Gendry is those two catching up and reconnecting and finding out what they’ve been doing. I really enjoyed working with Maisie in seasons 1-3 and I even said back then she’s one of the most talented actors I’ve ever worked with — not just young actors, but actors in general. To watch her get even better, not just Thrones but in various other things, I was looking forward to getting back on set with Maisie.” [x]

reblog.comment: And then there’s also Gendry’s reunion with Arya (Maisie Williams), who he last saw in season 3. “He’s reunited with Arya again. So a lot for Gendry is those two catching up and reconnecting and finding out what they’ve been doing. I really enjoyed working with Maisie in seasons 1-3 and I even said back then she’s one of the most talented actors I’ve ever worked with — not just young actors, but actors in general. To watch her get even better, not just Thrones but in various other things, I was looking forward to getting back on set with Maisie.” [x]

So a lot for Gendry is those two catching up and reconnecting and finding out what they’ve been doing. I really enjoyed working with Maisie in seasons 1-3 and I even said back then she’s one of the most talented actors I’ve ever worked with — not just young actors, but actors in general. To watch her get even better, not just Thrones but in various other things, I was looking forward to getting back on set with Maisie.” [x]

So a lot for Gendry is those two catching up and reconnecting and finding out what they’ve been doing. I really enjoyed working with Maisie in seasons 1-3 and I even said back then she’s one of the most talented actors I’ve ever worked with — not just young actors, but actors in general. To watch her get even better, not just Thrones but in various other things, I was looking forward to getting back on set with Maisie.” [x]
